Articles.Content:
Hey there everyone,

I wanted to share with you my new twitch project. it's been successful so far and have received plenty of save games already!

We had 3 live shows, and each of them were a hit!

The frequency of streams will depend on the amount of save games I receive from you guys, so for now, this will be a weekly show. The last one aired last night.

Here are some guidelines for the saveg game:

To participate, it's simple, start a new sandbox game, send a rocket to space, big or small and with however many Kerbins aboard, and lose them in space or on a planet!

Once a month, I will pick a random save game and will attempt to rescue the crew from your "failed" mission.

As I will have no idea of what's to rescue it will be a fun succession of scouting, then sending rescue ship(s) to bring the crew back home.

Here are some guidelines for you to follow:

  • try to make it fun to discover and have fun doing it!

  • A little made up background story on the failed mission is a nice way to start the stream

  • must be a manned ship (1 or more crew members and must all fit aboard the ship)

  • must be on a stable orbit or be landed on a planet/moon/asteroid

  • Let's keep it in Kerbin's influence for now. (minimus or mun is fine too) I am limiting this for now to keep stream length under 3 hours. I will organize special events with further destinations

  • must be in sandbox mode

  • must be only one lost ship in the save game

  • no mods! Cause I wont play with any!

  • send your save game to:
    [email protected]

It can be one of 3 scenario:

  • A rescue mission:

    Kerbals lost in space, in a broken ship. The ship will stay behind, but the kerbals will be saved (they could have no EVA monopropelant fuel left for example)

  • A refuel mission:

    Kerbals lost in space, in a ship with no fuel left. The ship will be refueled and will be returned to Kerbin with it's crew. Try to be nice and remember to add parachutes

  • A recover mission:

    Kerbals lost in space, in a small ship or part of a ship with no fuel left. There is valuable data that should be returned to Kerbin inside the ship. The ship will be returned to Kerbin with it's crew

Let me know in the email you send what scenario you chose.

If you want me to promote your page or any links please let me know in your email!

PS: A stuck Kerbal because you forgot to add a ladder to your ship is fine too, but I'm sure you can come up with something a little more challenging!

If you have any questions, let me know! See you soon!

I've made a pretty little flier to share with the world >>>
